channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: From Brontë to Ballard, Orwell to Okri: the best songs inspired by literature – ranked!
item.description: The oeuvre of Katy Perry occasionally has some profoundly unexpected inspirations: California Gurls is spelt in homage to Big Star’s September Gurls, while Firework was based on, wait for it, Jack Kerouac’s On the Road, specifically the line about how his favourite people “burn like fabulous yellow roman candles”.

item.title: We can move beyond the capitalist model and save the climate – here are the first three steps | Jason Hickel and Yanis Varoufakis
item.description: We have an urgent responsibility.

item.description: Australia has won its first medal of the 2026 Winter Olympic Games, with Cooper Woods claiming a stunning moguls gold.

item.title: Loyal dog who lived by owner's grave for 10 years inspires new law in Brazil
item.description: A dog who spent 10 years living in the São Paulo cemetery where his owner was buried has inspired a new law permitting the burial of pets with their families in the Brazilian state.

item.title: Can being codependent in a relationship actually be a good thing?
item.description: Many of us desire deeper relationships.

item.title: First Thing: Border patrol chief praised federal agent who shot US citizen in Chicago
item.description: Newly released evidence has shown that Gregory Bovino, a border patrol chief who was the face of the Trump administration’s mass deportation efforts until last month, praised a federal agent who shot a Chicago woman during an immigration crackdown last year. Marimar Martinez, a US citizen, was shot five times by a border patrol agent in October while in her vehicle.

item.title: Georgina Hayden’s quick and easy recipe for creamy chicken and mustard fricassee | Quick and easy
